Description: Handle fragment of pottery vase with round cross section; originally placed horizontally or facing somewhat upwards on inward curving vessel (shoulder?): stripes top and bottom, dots on edge. Porous, very micaceous pale brown clay, thin white slip.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Ledger number painted on object mostly flaked off. Possibly P 50? Possibly from Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.928)
